titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B151d
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B151d

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.which 2.the cutting(?)
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Hawafīʿa<th>at bin Śamīrum dedicated to Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm himself and his faculties and his children and his possessions and (this) altar which they possess when …] which he pos- 2.[sessed and gained legal possession of … the sons of ʾAʿriś … Dhū-ʾAmʿādim in the cultivated land of Dhū-Taḥribhān in Thalam, when Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm protected …] the cutting(?) […]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
which
the cutting?
Restored full text of the inscription:
Hawafīʿathat bin Śamīrum dedicated to Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm himself and his faculties and his children and his possessions and this altar which they possess when … which he pos-
sessed and gained legal possession of … the sons of ʾAʿriś … Dhū-ʾAmʿādim in the cultivated land of Dhū-Taḥribhān in Thalam, when Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm protected … the cutting? …
